title: BRENDAN O'NEILL: I fear Sir Keir's speech is a warning of the rampant wokery and intolerance that will sweep Britain if he gets into No 10
description: What rhetoric, Sir Keir! Such blather might go down well with the chattering ... all in the name of rewriting our history? In Starmer’s Britain, anyone who objects will be branded a mad, McCarthyite culture warrior. What a topsy-turvy Orwellian world ...

title: NHS could save £10bn by cracking down on waste Labour claim
description: Billions of pounds of taxpayers’ money is being wasted or poorly spent by the NHS each year on recruitment agencies, management consultants and archaic pagers, Labour has claimed. Shadow Health Secretary Wes Streeting believes the health service is throwing away around £10bn as a result of poor governance under the Conservatives.

title: Labour's David Lammy says he would work with Donald Trump - despite calling him a 'neo-Nazi-sympathising sociopath'
description: Mr Lammy, Labour's shadow foreign secretary, repeatedly criticised Mr Trump during his first presidency but said he would work with him if the pair ended up at either end of the so-called special relationship.

title: Middle East crisis live: UK says airstrikes are in ‘self-defence’ as Pentagon says bombing targeted Houthi underground missile sites
description: Pentagon details eight new strikes in joint statement with UK, Australia, Bahrain, Canada and the Netherlands, which supported latest bombing

title: US and UK carry out fresh strikes on Houthis
description: The UK and the US have once again carried out joint airstrikes against Houthi targets in Yemen. Officials say the US and UK took out Houthi missile storage sites and launchers, in the second set of co-ordinated strikes against the Iran-backed militants.

title: National Trust adviser claims he influenced Corbyn’s Labour manifesto
description: It comes as Sir Keir Starmer defends charity against accusations of ‘woke’ behaviour, claiming Conservatives have gone to ‘war’ with body

title: EPHRAIM HARDCASTLE: Would Boris Johnson be Rishi Sunak's ideal Washington ambassador if Donald Trump wins back the White House?
description: If Keir Starmer triumphs he might have a harder time placating a resurgent president. Yvette Cooper warned of the 'dangers' of Trump 'whipping up hatred and prejudice'.

title: Greater Manchester councillor changes allegiances
description: An Independent councillor's decision to change allegiances follows tough challenges to the Oldham budget. An independent Oldham councillor announced a surprise decision to switch parties following discussions about the incoming council budget.

title: Labour: Tories using culture wars 'as a wedge'
description: It comes after Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer claimed the Tories are "sabotaging" UK charities, adding that the government is "at war with the National Trust".

title: Keir Starmer keen to show he is not just ducking fights with the Tories
description: Labour leader’s latest speech is part of a broader strategy to take on the government

title: Keir Starmer’s own party could be his biggest headache
description: First and foremost, Sir Keir Starmer would be riding high on the hog, having turned his party round from the depths of a truly disastrous defeat to a sizeable majority in just under five years.

title: Sir Keir Starmer says Labour would ‘get ahead’ of torrential weather - as five killed by Storm Isha
description: A Labour Government would "get ahead" of torrential storms, Sir Keir Starmer has said, as he accused the Conservatives of implementing a "sticking plaster" approach over Storm Isha.

title: Keir Starmer defends National Trust against government 'woke' attacks as he vows to create 'society of service'
description: Sir Keir Starmer accused the government of attacking the "woke" National Trust, as he pledged to build a British "society of service" if elected to Downing Street.

title: Keir Starmer urged to sever ties with Tony Blair think tank

title: Fresh UK and US airstrikes on Houthi targets ‘deal another blow’ to militants

title: Keir Starmer attacks 'desperate' Conservative Government for stoking culture wars

title: General Election: Should SNP be talking up Labour's chances?
description: The SNP has decided who will win the next general election and, for once, a political party is not boasting about its own chances.

title: Labour campaign bible shows 'indifference to Scottish voters'

title: Senedd should not get Welsh police powers: Senior Labour MP
description: The most senior Welsh Labour MP in Westminster has rejected fresh calls for the Welsh government to be given control of policing and adult criminal justice. Shadow Welsh Secretary Jo Stevens said Labour would be focusing at the next election on "the things that matter".

title: London Playbook PM: Lords flex on Rwanda
description: To be fair: Ofcom reckons more than three quarters of adult Brits use WhatsApp, so it is a good place to attempt to get people to sign up for updates, and the U.K. is the first G7 nation to give it a shot. Playbook PM is told more than 4,000 people have signed up since it was launched this afternoon.

title: Conversation Keir Starmer Ramsay MacDonald
description: Writing for The Conversation, Dr Martin Farr discusses the similarities and differences between the challenges facing Ramsay MacDonald, and Sir Keir Starmer, should he be the next Prime Minister.

title: Britain can’t build without a trade revolution
description: Target of 300,000 new homes a year remains a myth unless we can plug the serious skills shortfall in UK construction

title: Ramsay MacDonald: The first Labour Prime Minister who still divides opinion 100 years on
description: Ramsey MacDonald first became Prime Minister 100 years ago today and continues to divide opinion. | ITV News Tyne Tees

title: Starmer accuses Tories of ‘waging war on proud spirit of service in country’
description: The Labour leader said Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives were ‘waging a war on the proud spirit of service in this country’.

title: Anas Sarwar challenged on Keir Starmer's £28 billion green pledge
